intro: Boechera quadrangulensis, commonly known as the four-angled rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers and four-angled stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Boechera quadrangulensis is adapted to harsh conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
